Name: Research local planning regulations and restrictions
Determine the purpose of the extension (e.g., new kitchen, extra bedroom, home office)
Set a preliminary budget
Explore financing options (e.g., savings, home improvement loan, remortgage)
Create a timeline for the project
Consider the impact on home insurance
Collect design inspiration (e.g., Pinterest boards, architectural magazines)
Define key features and must-haves
Consider energy efficiency and sustainability options
Decide on a design style (modern, traditional, eco-friendly)
Research and select an architect or designer
Hire a structural engineer (if structural changes are anticipated)
Consult with a planning advisor (especially if in a conservation area)
Choose a quantity surveyor for budget management
Select a project manager (if not self-managing)
Determine if planning permission is required
Submit a planning permission application (if necessary)
Understand and comply with the Party Wall Act (if applicable)
Secure building regulation approval
Check for any covenants on your property deed that may affect the project
Develop detailed plans with your architect
Create a detailed project budget
Plan for contingency funds (10-20% of the total budget)
Obtain detailed quotes from contractors
Finalize financing arrangements
Research and select a main contractor or builder
Check contractor references and previous work
Obtain and compare bids from contractors
Establish a clear contract with the chosen contractor
Plan for site access and setup (e.g., scaffolding, waste disposal)
Conduct a pre-construction meeting with all key stakeholders
Ensure proper permits are displayed on-site
Monitor construction progress and quality
Manage changes and adjustments to the plan
Schedule regular meetings with the contractor for updates
Keep a detailed record of all construction activities and expenses
Select interior finishes (flooring, tiles, paint colors)
Choose fixtures and fittings (lighting, faucets, appliances)
Plan for any custom joinery or cabinetry
Decide on window and door styles
Finalize the electrical and plumbing plans
Design the garden and outdoor spaces
Plan for external lighting and electrical needs
Consider decking, patios, or pathways
Choose external paint colors and finishes
Arrange for the final inspection by Building Control
Compile all warranties and manuals for new appliances and systems
Conduct a snagging list with the contractor
Update your home insurance to reflect the changes
Plan a housewarming or reveal party
Schedule regular maintenance for new installations (e.g., boiler service)
Plan seasonal checks and upkeep for the extension and garden areas
Create a long-term savings plan for future renovations or repairs
